text.__SUMMARY__:
Eucalyptus tortilis is a mallee tree that is native to the Goldfields-Esperance region of Western Australia.The mallee or tree typically grows to a height of 5 to 10 metres (16 to 33 ft) and has smooth bark. It blooms around May producing inflorescences with cream coloured flowers.
It is found on flats and rises between Kalgoorlie and Esperance in the Goldfields-Esperance region where it grows in calcareous loamy soils.E. tortilis  is one of the six true gimlet species that have buds in groups of seven. The other true gimlets are E. campaspe , E. effusa , E. salubris, E. ravida and E. ravida.
